name: Aquarium of the Bay
description: Aquarium of the Bay is a nonprofit aquarium located on Pier 39 in San Francisco, dedicated to protecting, restoring, and inspiring conservation of San Francisco Bay and its watershed. The aquarium features over 20,000 local marine animals including sharks, rays, jellyfish, and river otters.
fullDescription: Aquarium of the Bay is a nonprofit aquarium located on Pier 39 in San Francisco, dedicated to protecting, restoring, and inspiring conservation of San Francisco Bay and its watershed. The aquarium features over 20,000 local marine animals including sharks, rays, jellyfish, and river otters.
whatTheyOffer:
- Bay Area residents: $5 off general admission with local ID
- Military discount: 10% off for active duty, veterans, and families
- EBT/Museums for All: Reduced admission (check current rates)
- Children under 3: Free admission
- Annual passes available with unlimited visits
howToGetIt: Purchase tickets at the door or online. Bring valid Bay Area ID for local discount, military ID for military discount, or EBT card for Museums for All pricing. Discounts cannot be combined.
address: PIER 39, The Embarcadero & Beach Street, San Francisco, CA 94133
keywords: Aquarium of the Bay, Pier 39, San Francisco, sharks, jellyfish, river otters, marine animals, EBT discount, Museums for All, local discount
